alert.note: Alert for City of Hampton; City of Newport News (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 1:15PM EDT until August 28 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The City of Hampton in southeastern Virginia... The Southern City of Newport News in southeastern Virginia... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 115 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Newport News, Hampton, Hampton University, Langley AFB, Northampton, Fort Monroe, Buckroe Beach, Grand View, Langley View, Raleigh Terrace, Phoebus, Hilton Village and Fox Hill. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: City of Hampton; City of Newport News
